video.title: React Basics - Beau teaches JavaScript
video.description:
React.js is designed to make the process of building modular, reusable user interface components simple and intuitive. This video introduces React components, the VirtualDOM, JSX, state, and props. See how these things all tie together in a simple shopping list web app.

topLevelComment.author: Christian Hvass
topLevelComment.text:
How come it is necessary to slice the original list, before assigning it to newList?
What would newList = this.state.list accomplish?

replies.author: Christian Hvass
replies.text: Interesting, I'll have to dive deeper into that. Thanks for the answer! :-)

replies.author: Beau Carnes
replies.text: If you do newList = this.state.list it will not create a copy. In that case both 'newList' and 'this.state.list' would point to the exact same array. According to the React docs, if you make copies of state variables (which is done with slice) instead of changing them directly, you get better performance.
